description.narrative: The Project Development Objective is to improve access to quality and demand-responsive vocational training.The project will alleviate current and longer term skills constraints to contribute to Rwanda's transition to a middle income, export- and service oriented knowledge economy by 2020.

title.narrative: System in place to monitor and evaluate TVET performance, producing timely and accurate information

target.value: System produces M&E reports to guide WDA decisions.

title.narrative: Number of VTCs and IBT which have annual work plan and budget
Persons completing vocational training in VTCs and IBT
VTCs and IBT rehabilitated and/or equipped for targeted occupations
Curricula & teacher/training material validated for occupations targeted by the project
Examination mechanisms validated for occupations targeted by the project
Number of occupations for which training is offered in at least one targeted VTC or IBT using the new Competency Based Training Approach
Persons completing the training financed through Skills Development Facility
VTC and IBT graduates who carried out industrial attachment
SDF graduates who are employed or self-employed within six months of graduation
VTC and IBT graduates who are employed of self-employed within 6 months of graduation
Pre-employed persons trained through Skills Development Facility (SDF) sub-grants who improved job performance
Employer satisfaction with VTC and IBT graduates
